name: gsumcl2
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0

stmt.origin: gsumzcl2(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(ccntz, c0), c4, c5, w0)
stmt.pretty: gsumzcl2(c0, c1, c2, c3, (Cntz ` c0), c4, c5, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cmnd))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ccmn))

body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ Mnd)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ CMnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMnd → c0 ∈ Mnd)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cgsu, c1), c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(c0g, c0))
-| wceq(cfv(ccntz, c0), cfv(ccntz, c0))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c5))
-| wi(w0, wf(c1, c4, c2))
-| wi(w0, wss(crn(c1), cfv(cfv(ccntz, c0), crn(c1))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(co(c1, csupp, c3), cfn))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ccmn))
-| wi(wcel(c0, ccmn), wcel(c0, cmnd))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 →(c0[gsum]c1)∈ c2)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c0)
⊣ c3 =(0 ` c0)
⊣ (Cntz ` c0)=(Cntz ` c0)
⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ c5)
⊣ (w0 →(c1 : c4 → c2))
⊣ (w0 → ran(c1)⊆((Cntz ` c0)` ran(c1)))
⊣ (w0 →(c1[supp]c3)∈ Fin)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ CMnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMnd → c0 ∈ Mnd)

-| wi(w0, wcel(co(c1, csupp, c3), cfn))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ccmn))

comment: Closure of a finite group sum. This theorem has a weaker hypothesis than ~ gsumcl , because it is not required that ` F ` is a function (actually, the hypothesis always holds for any proper class ` F ` ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Dec-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2016.) (Revised by AV, 3-Jun-2019.)
